//notes: we model this bullet after Winchester 115gr FMJ
while not necessarily accurate in relation to the round it comes from in the mod, we deem it better to have inaccurate but approximate and complete data and correct later
description: A lead bullet in 9×19mm caliber, fully covered in a thin copper jacket, weighing 115 grains (roughly 7.45 grams).  FMJ bullets are valued for their ability to penetrate armor and soft cover, but they don't expand inside the wound.  You can use the bullet to load your own 9×19mm FMJ round.

A lead bullet in 9×19mm caliber, with a hollow nose and six grooves, weighing 124 grains (roughly 8 grams).  HST is a type of a jacketed hollow-point bullet, with the intended effect similarly being expansion inside the wound cavity to cause more damage; however, like other JHPs, HST is relatively-weak against body armor.  You can use the bullet to load your own 9×19mm HST round.

A lead bullet in 9×19mm caliber, covered in a copper jacket except for its hollow nose, weighing 115 grains (roughly 7.45 grams).  A jacketed hollow-point projectile designed for maximum expansion, this bullet will cause grievous injury inside the body; however, like other JHPs, it's relatively-weak against body armor.  You can use the bullet to load your own 9×19mm JHP ME round.

A lead bullet in 9×19mm caliber, covered in a copper jacket except for its hollow nose, weighing 115 grains (roughly 7.45 grams).  A jacketed hollow-point projectile, this bullet will expand inside the body and cause serious damage to tissues; however, like other JHPs, it's relatively-weak against body armor.  You can use the bullet to load your own 9×19mm JHP round.
